data.title: Govt sends letter of protest to Israel
data.description: The government has submitted a letter of protest to  Israel , requesting that no more Thai workers be sent to high-risk areas following a recent rocket attack that killed four Thai workers and injured one.

data.title: FM pushes regional partnerships
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa said on Saturday that Thailand aims to work with South Asian countries on food, energy and human security to boost trade with the Southeast region.

data.title: Chiang Mai backs waste-to-energy plant
data.description: The Chiang Mai Authority has backed a Thai-Chinese  waste-to-energy power plant  that is expected to take two years to complete.

data.title: BMA to enact new pet policy
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) will implement a new policy to regulate the number of domesticated  cats  and  dogs  in the city.

data.title: Pheu Thai MP warns of legal action over 'lies'
data.description: The government

data.title: Pheu Thai's legal eagles urge charter compromise
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party has not ruled out the possibility of amending the  charter  in time for the next election as long as certain compromises can be agreed upon.

data.title: Drunk German biker smashes checkpoint, injures officer
data.description: PATTAYA - A German tourist has been arrested after crashing through a traffic police checkpoint on his big bike on Jomtien Road in Bang Lamung district, leaving the policeman seriously injured.

data.title: Orange Line construction disruptions expected
data.description: Construction of the western segment of the MRT  Orange Line  will cause some disruptions, the Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) has advised.

data.title: Alleged leader of Rohingya smuggling gang arrested
data.description: A Thai man accused of leading a  human trafficking  gang has been arrested along with two accomplices in connection with the smuggling of 26 Rohingya  migrants, three of whom died of suffocation in an overcrowded truck, police said on Saturday.

data.title: United Nations Development Programme tie-up to bolster climate change resilience
data.description: Efforts are being made to strengthen Thailand

data.title: Purple Line flat rate fare to stay at B20
data.description: The Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) aims to extend the Purple Line

data.title: Scout uniform rules to relax
data.description: The Education Ministry will issue a regulation on scouting attire, allowing children to wear ordinary school attire instead of scout uniforms for scout events.

data.title: Phatthalung to push airport plan
data.description: Authorities and the local tourism sector plan to build an airport in Phatthalung to promote the province as a new logistics hub for the southern region.

data.title: UNDP tie-up to bolster climate change resilience
data.description: Efforts are being made to strengthen Thailand

data.title: 5m workers to be reskilled
data.description: The Department of Skill Development (DSD) plans to upskill and reskill more than five million Thai workers in 2025 with a special focus on digital technology to support industrial growth, says a senior labour official.

data.title: Zoo body slams monastery's use of hippo
data.description: The Zoological Park Organization has slammed a Buddhist monastery for using the image of "Moo Deng", the pygmy hippo and social media sensation, to produce Moo Deng trinkets used as sacred objects for wealth.

data.title: 10 'model' provinces to reckon with tackling drug problems
data.description: The government has announced 10 pilot provinces to test out ways of combatting issues related to narcotics.

data.title: Loy Krathong to shine at Wat Arun
data.description: Wat Arun Ratchawararam, also known as the Temple of Dawn, will host a Loy Krathong festival on Nov 15, with the festival

data.title: Monorails safe to use, insists MRTA
data.description: Wuhu: The reputation of Bangkok

data.title: Workerâ€™s distraught family pleads for return of body from Israel
data.description: BURI RAM - The family of one of the four Thai workers killed by rocket fire in Israel was saddened by the death and hopes to see his body returned soon for a religious ceremony at home.

data.title: Typhoon Kong-rey kills one Thai in Taiwan
data.description: One Thai was killed in a car accident during the super typhoon in Taiwan, according to the Foreign Ministry.

data.title: Six police, one civilian arrested for alleged extortion
data.description: Six police officers and a civilian were arrested for allegedly trying to extort 300 million baht from a Chinese-Vanuatu man in Samut Prakan province. The victim had already paid them 5.7 million baht after negotiations.

data.title: Pattaya banks on big tunnel to end persistent floods
data.description: The people of Pattaya are hopeful that a new drainage tunnel will help resolve the resort city

data.title: Moo Deng leads Thailand's cultural promotion project
data.description: The Ministry of Culture has announced a project to promote Thai culture to the world, featuring celebrity pygmy hippo Moo Deng as the presenter.

data.title: PM says she's feeling better
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  took to social media yesterday to thank the public for their support during her recovery from  bronchitis , saying she was feeling better.

data.title: UTN wants stiffer fraud sentences
data.description: The United Thai Nation (UTN) Party will propose amending the law to limit the Corrections Department

data.title: No Brics membership for kingdom yet
data.description: Thailand has not yet been confirmed as a member of the Brics international organisation, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA).

data.title: Group seeks Trang airport resolution
data.description: A civic group in the southern province of Trang is petitioning the Ministry of Transport to speed up its handling of a construction problem at Trang airport which the group believes is to blame for a drop in the number of air passengers and a hike in air ticket prices.

data.title: Migrant decision stirs fury
data.description: The government has defended its decision to grant  Thai citizenship  to  migrants  and members of ethnic minorities, saying the policy is in line with the law.

data.title: Investors cry foul at 'clean energy scam'
data.description: A group of 20 people yesterday petitioned the Economic Crime Suppression Division (ECD) of the police

data.title: No more free rides for BRT commuters
data.description: Riders on the Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) system in Bangkok will need to purchase e-tickets, starting Friday, as City Hall has ended over a year of free rides.

data.title: Four Thai nationals killed near Israel-Lebanon border
data.description: Four Thai agricultural workers were killed and one was injured by rocket fire near Metula, Israel

data.title: Low orders force factories to lay off 2,600 employees
data.description: About 2,600 factory workers have been laid off over the past two days as their employers were forced to scale down operations due to financial problems.
